Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Thank you, Paul Lohman, for that eloquent solo. Now, for that point in the ceremonies where we formally dedicate this magnificent resort- hotel complex, a worthwhile addition to the recreational paradise we call Amity.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: I can see that. Don't you know this is a big deal?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Couldn't help it. Hendricks over there...  ...still has the keys to the jeep in his pocket, and I couldn't find the spares.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Terrific. Act as if you've been here all along.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: How'm I supposed to do that?

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: ...And now, Tina Wilcox, this year's Miss Amity, will cut the ribbon that officially opens this luxurious new hotel...

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Tina was selected from more than 20 of this island's lovely young ladies in the Miss Amity competition held every spring, and she'll represent Amity Island in the Miss Massachusetts Competition in Worcester next month. When she cuts this ribbon, she will be opening our island to growth, to development, to planned expansion with full employment for our thriving community.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: I don't think she's such hot stuff.

Speaker: polo
Dialogue: When are we going out? You and me?

Speaker: polo
Dialogue: Listen, Jane -- you want to dance as soon as we get out of these monkey suits?

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Mom, Michael won't talk to me.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: This money tree, you may have noticed, is made entirely of twenty-dollar bills, donated by Len Peterson, the builder of Amity Shores Condominiums, as a gesture of goodwill towards the community. $500 as a special gift to the Amity township scholarship fund...

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Thanks to Tom Andrews, of Amity Aqua- Sports, for contributing the special decorations. And now, the Amity High School band. Refreshments on the patio, everyone...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Do I have to talk to those two?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: My boss and your boss. Sure.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Hello, hello. It went well, I thought.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Thank you, thank you. You know my son, don't you?

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: The speech was right on the money.  Be a love and make sure the bar's open, will you?

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: Fantastic lady. Don't know what I'd do without her.

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: Y'know, Brody -- for the first time in years it's worth putting money into this town.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: All of us thank you, okay?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'm not crazy about blind dates.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: They're okay, if they got little white canes and tin cups.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What the hell.  Did your mom put all this together?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Is she responsible for the punch?

Speaker: brooke
Dialogue: My cousin will be here tomorrow.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Michael, Michael, Dad said to find you.

Speaker: timmy
Dialogue: You're crazy. She's Ed's girl friend.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Doesn't hurt to ask. Sometimes the most beautiful girls are the loneliest.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Same tired old faces. You see Vaughn?

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Larry Vaughn Junior?  If you see him, tell him I got a six- pack, a blanket, and the Brebner twins.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: None at all.  I wonder what the Brebner twins are doing tomorrow night.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Can you take a little time out from your busy schedule to dance with the old man?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Sorry, I'm all booked up...  Come, m'dear.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: And how. I thought you wouldn't respect me.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Listen -- what are you doing later?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You're getting a little big for this.

Speaker: sean's voice
Dialogue: The milk fell out of the 'frigerator.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Put a towel down. And shh -- daddy's sleeping.

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: Heck of a way to treat a taxpayer.  Don't you have any pull with the chief, here?

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: Better get a sales kit together for after lunch. I'm taking some prospects out.

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: Can't we fix it up to get this made into a green zone or something?

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Tie it off on your left. Your other left!

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Till noon. This is on my own time.  Hi, Shorty.

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: You got a gold-plater drifting in the main channel. Big cruiser.

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: Off the Point. No running lights, just a diver's flag.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Want me to run out there?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Then check it out. I'll be in the office.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Cast off your bow line. And your stern line. Spring line...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No place special. Just hanging out.

Speaker: polo
Dialogue: Anyone want to sail to the lighthouse?

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Anyone got a spare mooring line? Mine's shot.

Speaker: brooke
Dialogue: You're not going out right away, are you?

Speaker: brooke
Dialogue: I want you to meet my cousin.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I want to go out with you. You need a crew, don't you?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I don't need you. Andy's here.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Same as always -- glub-glub, bubble- bubble, stroke-stroke. There sure is some weird shit on the bottom of the ocean.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Mostly old garbage. Today we found a '48 Hudson.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Do I have to play with the little kids?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Who's that? Quick -- I'm in love.

Speaker: brooke
Dialogue: Over here. I want you to meet somebody.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Hey, get out of our air!

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Rich or poor, it's nice to have money.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Happens every season -- someone takes off. Once we had a schooner for a month while the owners went fox hunting.

Speaker: indignant man
Dialogue: I can't watch the news, I can't watch a ball game, I can't watch movies -- all I hear is that rotten kid with his rotten radio... "Breaker, Breaker..."

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I'll do what I can, but you're talking about a federal jurisdiction...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Thanks. What else is out there?

Speaker: polly
Dialogue: One petty theft, one domestic disturbance, and an exhibitionist.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I'll take the exhibitionist, you handle the others.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Chief Brody? I want you to do something about my first husband.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: In a minute, in a minute -- talk to Mrs. Prendergast, please...

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Albert keeps coming around when I'm with gentlemen friends and he throws mud on their cars...

Speaker: 2nd man
Dialogue: Every time there's an out- of-state car in my driveway, I lose another mailbox. Those little iron sailboats cost thirty-two dollars each!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Talk to me about Mrs. Kinney.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Hendricks. I want to go over your

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I just made it up. It means, "Get me out of there."  What the hell's that?

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Diver's camera. Tom Andrews brought it up from under that abandoned cruiser.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Abandoned? It's a little early in the season for that.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Rich people. Home port is Newport, Rhode Island.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: If I had a $100,000 boat, I sure as hell wouldn't leave it anchored alone in the channel.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: If you had a $100,000 boat there'd be an investigation.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Hendricks, get a description of that dance.

Speaker: large man
Dialogue: Chief Brody? I want to talk to you about my daughter... she's 15, but mature for her age...

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Chief, I've been telling Mrs. Prendergast that it's no good just talking about Albert, she's got to do something...

Speaker: 2nd man
Dialogue: Look -- the township is responsible for protecting life and property, and my property is unprotected...

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Did you ever see a dolphin?

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: Sure. They like to play. We may see some today.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Whoops, almost lost one. Can't play with the dolphins without skis...

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Hang on, hang on... Okay, go.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Take a break for a minute, okay?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Eddie, can we do that?  Can we go skiing? We can use my Uncle's boat. Eddie?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: With you, everything's next week. I want to go skiing soon. Tomorrow?

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: I can't find anyone out here. They must've gone to the bottom, or drifted with the current.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: There should be bodies. Witnesses say two people; one in the boat, one skiing.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Stay on it. I don't care how long it takes.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: We heard this noise, like a 'boomp' out there, and when we looked, there was just this cloud of smoke.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: That was the explosion. One minute they were having a wonderful time, the next, bang!

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: I don't know what could've done that.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Chief Brody -- can we go? Please?

Speaker: red
Dialogue: I don't care about the overtime, I'm hungry. And cold. And most of all, bored.

Speaker: red
Dialogue: It comes here from Cable Junction.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Untangle it and let's go -- We don't need a blackout on the island.

Speaker: red
Dialogue: Now you're talking. Let's get out of here before we do find something.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: You have to smoke so early in the morning?

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: You eat Cheerios. I want Fruit Loops.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I don't know about him -- I'm going down to the dock, maybe go sailing.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What else is there to do?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You could work out at the beach, make a few bucks for school.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You'll have to make up your own mind about that.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: He doesn't have to work all the time, it's his vacation.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Why don't you take a half day and clean this junk up?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Because, I'm in the middle of a boating accident, I got only four regular cops and one secretary, and a Chief Deputy who is constantly fiddling with the police boat. He's another one.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Boat nut. What is it about this place that makes everyone a freak for boating?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: It's an island.  Got to run.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What about tennis? Riding? Fixing up old cars? Bartending?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Okay, not bartending. Why on the water every day?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Look, humor the old man -- just be careful.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'll be careful. I'll see y'later.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Don't go out if it's rough or anything, huh? We've had a lot of trouble.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Can I go with you today?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You stay with Mrs. Silvera, Tootsie. Okay?

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Bye, Daddy. I'm going to be careful, all day.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Oh, out a ways. Maybe the lighthouse.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: No big thing, we'll see who's out there, maybe picnic.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: We got some stuff at the store. Ed and Tina are going to be there.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: It's an island, near here, with a lighthouse. We sometimes hang out there, you know...

Speaker: brooke
Dialogue: The lighthouse is a make-out spot.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Now I really want to see it.

Speaker: brooke
Dialogue: You going to fool around with Mike?  Well, I'm not doing anything with him.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Too hot for those two? I can't believe it.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Is there something I don't know about?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Oh, yeah. So why aren't they doing it now?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: As soon as I heard about it, I called you. This thing is big!

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Move back, please... back off... open it up a little...

Speaker: elkins
Dialogue: From the tip of the snout, please.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Come on, let's check the bite radius.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Bite radius. You know, the size of the mouth?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: The shark that did this. It was a shark, wasn't it?

Speaker: elkins
Dialogue: We don't know that, do we?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: But that's what we're here to find out, right?

Speaker: elkins
Dialogue: You don't tell me my job, and I won't tell you about yours, okay?

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: I can't hear you if you're going to whisper.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: We'll be over by the lighthouse.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'll be right there. Wait up.

Speaker: elkins
Dialogue: Could be a shark. But maybe not.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Look, I know a little bit about sharks.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I know that this was probably a Great White Shark. Car-cadon... Caradan...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Is there one in these waters?

Speaker: elkins
Dialogue: What makes you think there might be?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Because this big fish has been bitten by some other big fish...

Speaker: elkins
Dialogue: This is a mammal, not a fish.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Jesus, don't quibble with me. I want to know if a Great White Shark did this.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: That's it? Probably? Look, sharks are attracted by blood, and thrashing around...

Speaker: elkins
Dialogue: Sound. Like sonar, or radar. They home in on irregular sounds, unusual sounds, any rhythmic low-frequency vibration.

Speaker: elkins
Dialogue: Not necessarily. These wounds could've been inflicted 30 miles out to sea, or more. None of them are immediately fatal. Currents could've carried the body 10 miles further.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: We got a helluva tide this month.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Could you just keep that crowd back, please?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You stay right here. You're going in with me.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: We came out in my boat.

Speaker: elkins
Dialogue: Lower jaw displaced and lacerated by predator attempt to seize the tongue. Additional large tissue loss in the dorsal and sub- dorsal areas, as well as the caudal. Oriamal bite radius 37 inches, allowing for salt-water erosion and subsequent small predator and scavenger tissue attacks...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I don't want to discuss it.

Speaker: elkins
Dialogue: It's either a Great White, or another killer whale.

Speaker: elkins
Dialogue: Not when it's like this. This animal has been ashore for 10, 12 hours, and drifting for a day, at least. Every little nibbler in the sea's taken a bite.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Look -- can Great White Sharks communicate? Send out signals, or something? You know, take revenge, sense an enemy...

Speaker: elkins
Dialogue: Don't be ridiculous -- Sharks don't take things personally.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: No more sailing. You come back with me, and that's it.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'll tie up at the town dock, don't worry, man.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: I'm showing summer rentals. We got a helluva season going.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: We have got to talk, and we have got to talk alone.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Larry, I don't know how to say this, but I think we got a shark problem. A real one.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Of course. Look -- I've got some missing persons, fatalities, evidence of a large predator...

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: No one has seen a shark -- no fin, no bites, nothing. Be realistic.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I got a feeling. I have to act on it -- you can understand that, can't you?

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Of course I can, but can't it wait? These things cost money, and this town doesn't have much money.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: We have done something -- hell, we damn near went broke putting up a shark watch tower on the beach -- it's the only one in 2000 miles, y'know.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: And I stood by while you told the people from Ramada and Marriott that if they put up a hotel they'd need $800,000 worth of steel net around their beaches! In New England? We all lost on that one.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Martin, when we build up our tax base a little, you can have everything you want; right now, the town's broke.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Please, Larry -- there's good reason. Those water skiers...

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: A tragedy. But that was a boating accident; no bites, no sharks, nothing but a boating accident.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Two of them are still missing!

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: There's always deaths in these waters that never turn up. Are they all shark victims?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Bullshit? I'll give you bullshit -- there's a dead whale out there with bites all over it!

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: What am I, an ass? When you called me, I called Elkins, and her bosses. Nothing she saw is proof of anything.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Don't push it this time. If you do, it won't turn out the way you want, I guarantee you that.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: I've got to get back to work.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Come on, give a guy a break.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Come on. Here boy. Come to Poppa...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Come here. Come on, Sweetheart. You bastard. A little closer... Here y'go...

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: I missed you at the funeral home. Santos said you were here.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You didn't miss much. Christ, what a mess.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: The woman passenger on the boat that blew up.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: That one -- from the wreck. You brought it up, did you look inside it?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Well, what the hell -- might be something worth seeing. Take it somewhere and see if there's film in it...

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: I know just where to go.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Of course not, They're closed. Phil Fogarty's place. He'll do it for me.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: The drugstore's closed? What the hell time is it?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Shit -- I'm late for dinner... Close up, okay?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Oh yeah -- I'm expecting a long distance call, very important. Give them my home phone.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Sort of -- Matthew Hooper is aboard the research vessel Aurora, presently in the Antarctic Ocean, and won't be in radio range until half-past next spring.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Oh, perfect -- a 75 per cent family affair. Where were you?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: That's what I said. Is there any of that hand cleaner stuff?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Use the little brush there. Why were you at Santos'?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Found one of the missing victims from that boat deal.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Oh. Want to talk about it?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You want to come here a minute?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I got something for you to do tomorrow.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Sailing?  Forget it. You're beached. Grounded. No more boats.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: No backtalk! I spoke to Upton, at the beach, and he's got a job for you there. You can work until school starts.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: He wanted a job, he's got one. I want to see that boat out of the water by tomorrow night.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I know what you're going to say.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: In the city, it happened all the time -- some Kid o.d.'s on a rooftop, top, a drunk gets cut in pieces under the Brooklyn local, old people die alone in shitty apartments and three weeks later someone calls the cops because of the smell and the flies. Call the cops. What are we, immune?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: The goddamn smell is always the same.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Are you going to be able to sleep?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Yeah. I think so.  Mike! Keep it down, for chrissake!

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: This is the town beach; the development naturally has its own private access, but I wanted you to see the concession area. Look at that sand -- like sugar!

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: During the summer, the sun sets right there...  Over the water. Beautiful.

Speaker: nichols
Dialogue: Hello -- selling some more of the good life?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: A piece here, a piece there, it all adds up.

Speaker: nichols
Dialogue: Your husband's been here all morning. What's he doing?

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: You know where your dad is?

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: And if you have any questions about recreational possibilities, Ellen Brody here will be happy to answer them.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Len, can I see you a minute?

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: I think we got a couple of live ones.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: This is fun! Can we go faster?

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: How the hell do we get him down from there?

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Maybe nobody will notice. Let's get them back in the bus.

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: It's a shark tower. I saw one in Florida. He's looking for sharks.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: It's an observation platform. That's our Chief of Police. He's just checking it.

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: Normally, it's used for, ah, bird watching. Nature observation. Weather measurements, that sort of thing.  Ellen, we're running late!

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Okay. Folks, if we could get back on, we'll show you the country club, and stop for lunch...

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: The country club has an 18-hole course, putting greens, and twelve tennis courts...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Out of the water! Everyone out of the water!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Get out of the water! Tell everyone to get out! Now! Out of the water!

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: What the hell is he doing?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Out of the water! Now! Everyone!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: No! Don't go in! Stay out! Stay clear!

Speaker: lifeguard
Dialogue: It's bluefish! It's a school of bluefish! Chief! It's bluefish!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Okay, it's all over, go on, it's over. No trouble...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: It's all right, everything's all right...

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: You should've been out there. You should've seen him waving that gun, like a maniac. There were shots fired!

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: He thought he had a good reason.

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: Larry, I'm a businessman, trying to make a buck like anybody else.

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: So it can't be done like that. The man's a menace, plain and simple.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Look, what am I supposed to do? It's done, it's over. We have to deal with the consequences.

Speaker: sansom
Dialogue: That's what we're here to do.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: All right. Let's go into my office, where we can have a little privacy.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: I believe we have a quorum, and informally, I suggest we call this meeting an executive session and dispense with minutes...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Polly, no calls, please...  Hello... Phil? Fogarty? What pictures... I'll be right down...

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: I don't know what you did, but that kid stopped. I haven't heard one peep, not one 'breaker breaker' for days. Believe me, it's a pleasure...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You said something about a camera.

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: Sure, sure -- Jeff Hendricks brought in this camera, see, from underwater, and I didn't know how to get it open, but my brother-in-law, in Montauk, he works at a hi-fi store, and they sell cameras, so he...

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: Well, yeah, I did, that's the funny thing. You can't tell much from the negatives, I was going to blow 'em up. Here's a test I did...

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: Not bad -- that's a real fast lens, probably 1.4. Look at the diffusion, though...

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: Let's see -- you got a minute?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Come on, Phil, don't jerk me around.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Thank God you guys were all together. I got something for you. Proof!

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Martin, this is kind of an official meeting

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Chief -- the Board of Selectmen has a question only you can answer.

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: Is Jeff Hendricks qualified to fill in as an interim Chief of Police in your absence?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Temporarily? Uh... sure... The question's out of left field. Why are they asking?

Speaker: nichols
Dialogue: So Jeff could handle things? He knows the routine, he has the authority?

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: It came up during the meeting.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Look -- I just got this from Phil Fogarty. It was in the camera belonging to the missing divers. It proves I was right, all along.

Speaker: nichols
Dialogue: It's underwater, isn't it? That's why it's so dark.

Speaker: sansom
Dialogue: I don't know -- what is it?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: It's a shark! A Great White! Jesus, it's right there!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What are you all, blind? It's a shark. Look -- teeth, jaw, gills.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You're damn right that's what it is.

Speaker: nichols
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I just don't see it.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What the hell does it take to make sense to you numbskulls? Jesus, it's right there in front of you. I know what a goddamn shark looks like, I've been through it, don't you understand? I've seen this sonofabitch before!

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: What have you seen before? This is nothing. Seaweed. Mud. Something in the lens.

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: You really caused a panic on a public beach, you shoot up the place, God knows who could've been injured -- what if somebody decides to sue us? That could ruin us.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Is that what it is? Dollars? Money? I'll pay for it. Take it out of my salary.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Maybe I don't make as much money as some bullshit rip-off artists around here, but I don't work the same way.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: It means I don't like all that grab- ass and heavy breathing with my wife, it means I know who's out to screw me here, and it means that I know something none of you know because I've been there -- and I don't want to go through that horror again. Ever!

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Martin, could you wait here for a few minutes while we make up our minds about something?

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: I won't mention his personal attack on me.

Speaker: nichols
Dialogue: I've never seen him like this.

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: And Hendricks is qualified, you heard that from his own mouth.

Speaker: kaiser
Dialogue: We made a motion and it was already seconded.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Very well then. It is moved and seconded that Martin Brody be relieved of his duties as Chief of Police, his contract with the township be terminated, and that Jeff Hendricks be appointed Acting Chief in the interim. Those in favor?

Speaker: peterson
Dialogue: Anyone opposed, or is it unanimous?

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: I'm sorry, but I respect his convictions. The motion is carried.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Martin? Could you come in please?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Hi. I closed a sale today, without Len. That's $1200 commission, if the papers go through.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You look about 22 years old sitting there. Like you were doing homework...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Ooohh, nothing. I just got fired, that's all.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Then that's what I meant. Fired. Canned. Out on my fanny. The Selectmen just made Hendricks the new Chief of Police. Just like that.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: No sweat. A blessing in disguise. Back to the city, you can go to Bloomingdale's without waiting six hours for the ferryboat... we're surrounded by water here, you realize that? Me, surrounded by water... Ridiculous.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Stop that! We're not going any place. You love it here. Tell me what the hell happened!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Showed them the photo, showed them the goddamn Shark, big as life. They didn't see it. Not like me. Not like the poor son-of-a-bitch who snapped this li'l picture... He's out there, somewhere... I shot off my gun, shot off my big mouth, so they fired me...

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Honey, this is nothing... I don't know what it is. What did they...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: ...Everybody wants the job. No one wants the authority. Except Hendricks. Fine. He can go out there in that precious boat, and when he looks whitey in his big mouth he can just call me. Call me in New York... tell him to kiss my ass...

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: They have no right to treat you like that. You've given them everything. For four years, you've protected this town, the people on this island...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Fired me!  I'm not a hysterical man. I'm responsible. I know what I saw...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I try. Goddamnit, I tried... Now, I'm tired... I can't keep fighting it... I'm too tired... I'm... I'm...

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: You're drunk is what you are...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Is dad home? I heard something...

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Shhhh. Go back upstairs. Daddy's sleeping.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: That's what I want -- a gaff rig.

Speaker: timmy
Dialogue: Gaff rigged? Why not a staysail schooner? Go anywhere. Look at this -- the Mayan, an Alden schooner.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Hey, Mike -- I saw your dad over at the town hall.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Did he really freak out at the beach?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Hey, it's all bullshit. Anyone want to play pong for money?

Speaker: polo
Dialogue: Anyone want to go the lighthouse?

Speaker: polo
Dialogue: Nah. Tomorrow. Early, spend the day. My folks left two cases of beer in the garage.

Speaker: polo
Dialogue: Nope. Got it in my boat.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I thought you might still be painting the restrooms at the beach.

Speaker: brooke
Dialogue: Anyone want a coke or anything?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I'd like to go out to the lighthouse with you.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Maybe you and Brooke could come over to the town beach...

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: No way. Everybody's going sailing. If you don't want to take me, just say so.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: That's not it. My dad told me not to go.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: You do everything your parents tell you?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Good. I'll be on the dock at eight.  Eight o'clock, everybody!

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Who's bringing the wine? And who's got a quarter for the box?

Speaker: brooke
Dialogue: She just likes to tease. I think she really likes you.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I want to go with you!

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: What're you going to do today?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Turn in the car. Clean my desk, explain things to our sons, then maybe get shit-faced and punch your boss.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Don't rush into it -- we may need the income.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Mike left early. Couldn't wait to make out. Must be a morning man.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Sean's not up yet. You know what he likes, just some Fruit Loops and milk. No candy.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: The sink upstairs is busted. Try some Drano, or a plunger, maybe. Or call your brother, the plumber, what's his name...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Frankie. Okay. Ask him if he needs an apprentice.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: If you're beached, why are we doing this? For practice?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Then why are we futzing around the dock? We can make a few bucks working at the beach.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Look -- if you're going to get in the way, you can just go home.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I'm not in the way. Andy, am I in the way?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: This guy giving you any trouble?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Put him down in the water.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: You want to go out in my boat?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You've just made someone very happy.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I can go out if I want to.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I could give you a dozen good reasons.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay, okay, don't say I didn't remind you.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Is there room on your boat for all of us?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Well, we're pretty crowded, and I don't know when we're leaving...

Speaker: brooke
Dialogue: Great.  That's okay -- I'll go with Timmy.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: I thought you said she was going with us?

Speaker: andrews
Dialogue: Hey! Nicholas! You're supposed to be in class!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Today I'm staying topside. You dive for me!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: With butter, if they got any...

Speaker: andrews
Dialogue: Sparky will take you down today. If everyone's got a buddy, we'll drop.

Speaker: sparky
Dialogue: Get us in! For Christ's sake, get us in!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: You want to tack, or just leave her pointed up like this?

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: The tide's running. It'll take us to the light.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: It'll take us to Budapest if you're not careful.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: They'll be there when we get there. Might even have a fire started.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: What're we going to do in the mean time?

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: I dunno. We'll think of something.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Wait a minute. Promise me something.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: That you'll put down a blanket. I've got black and blue marks all over my butt, and my Mom's getting uptight about them.

Speaker: polo
Dialogue: Great day! I think the wind's going to change...

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: I'm getting new sails, then watch out. Just a question of modifying the rigging!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Like hell! We're on the starboard tack!

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: When do we get to the lighthouse?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: We're going to be fighting the current.  Wind's backing around a few points, too.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I can't wait to get there.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Hey -- it's not your job any more. I'm going to be late for work.

Speaker: sparky
Dialogue: Embolism. Air bubbles in his blood. Came up too damn fast. Held his goddamn breath!

Speaker: attendant
Dialogue: It's okay. We're taking care of him.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Right after, the Kids went out?

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: All of them. Mike, Junior Vaughn, Brookie Peters, Pat, Lucy -- all that whole gang.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Yep. Looked like they were headed to the lighthouse.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: About an hour, maybe two.  Let's see -- I came on about eight...

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Uh, Chief -- look. You're not Chief any more.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: I can't let you take her out.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Mrs. Brody, look -- if he can't go, then you can't go. Neither of you can go.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: But I signed for the boat. You're not authorized any more.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Goddamnit, Hendricks, untie the rope there.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: What the hell, they can't fire both of us -- someone's got to be in charge, right? Which way are we going?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Find the Kids. The lighthouse -- you said something about the lighthouse. Get us there.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Amity Launch to Harbor Patrol, over.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Affirmative. Can you get your chopper airborne?

Speaker: patrol voice
Dialogue: 10-4, in a few minutes. He's down checking a buoy in the Bay Channel.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Get him the hell over to Amity Point, the old lighthouse. Right now.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: There's a bunch of Kids day-sailing that way. Turn them back to port.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: That's it. Just do it, all right?

Speaker: patrol voice
Dialogue: 10-4, soon as I can raise him.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: If they're not at the light, look for them. I don't want them out there. Get them back to port!

Speaker: patrol voice
Dialogue: Affirmative, affirmative. Turn the Kids day-sailing back to port. I heard you. Patrol out.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: How about a side bet to make it interesting?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: That's fun! Let's race for something!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You're betting what you already got.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Sure you do -- you win either way.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: It's a bet. Once around the marker buoy?

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Hey! Wait for the H.M.S. Invincible!

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Mike and Larry are racing! Loser goes home alone!

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: If we beat them, they can both go home stag! Single-O! Alone! Jackie can come back in this boat!

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Uh. Well. Maybe you could give Polo a hand going in...

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Your ass I will. Besides, the wind's turning with the tide. Sailing back is going to be a bitch.

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: Air Patrol to Base. I have visual contact on the Kids. Going down to use the loud hailer...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Your dad must be really pissed.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: It's not going to be easy.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: We're fighting wind and current. I though we'd be out longer, catch the incoming tide.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Putz -- that won't be for hours.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Make way for the Carrier Enterprise!

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: Patrol One to Base. Looks like they're turning back.

Speaker: control
Dialogue: All right, Patrol. Go back to work. You've wasted enough time.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: It's okay, it's okay. What's the matter? Tina? Honey? Hey --

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I knew it. I goddamn well told them.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Skip that. What about those kids out sailing?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Get him the hell back there! We got possible fatalities! Brody out...

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: What is it? What's the matter?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Get her in. Get them both in.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: About 10 degrees off your starboard bow, take a heading leeward of Sand Island, and lay her north by northeast...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Never mind that shit. Just point.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: See where Cable Junction is? Look to the left. The lighthouse. That's it.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: My purse is on that boat.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Mr. Christian! Mr. Christian! Pump up this boat! And shave that silly moustache!

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: England expects every man to do his duty... You may fire when ready, Gridley... Damn the torpedoes, full speed ahead...

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: You sail your boat, I'll sail mine.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Company? The place is a mess...

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: So much for the rubber duck.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: I'm telling you, a goddamn shark ate my goddamn boat!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: If he liked your boat, I got some sneakers he'll love.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Tie off to your strongest point.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Amity Launch to Patrol Air Unit One. Harbor Air, where are you?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: It's me. Any fix on those Kids?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: For Christ's sake, get going! I'm all alone out here!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Where the hell is Francis Shoal?

Speaker: runby
Dialogue: The Amity Police Boat, under full power, surging through the heavy swell, Brody very much alone at the helm.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Anyone know what time it is?

Speaker: brooke
Dialogue: Tide doesn't turn for three hours.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Low tide at Cable Junction is 7:46 p.m.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What'd you do? Memorize the tide tables?

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: I can't help it, it sticks in my mind.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: As long as we're drifting, might as well go with the flow.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: At least. And an offshore wind.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: They tend to follow moving things. Maybe it's following Polo and Timmy.

Speaker: brooke
Dialogue: So all we have to do is land at Cable Junction and wait.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: First we got to get there.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: How're we going to do that floating on this garbage...?

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Anyone got another set of sails?

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Is that big thing still out there?

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: Air One to Base. I have a positive location on that sailing party. Disabled and adrift...  ...about 3/4 miles west of Cable Junction, wind and current carrying them just about due east. I count ten juveniles.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Can you put us on Cable Junction?

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: I got no room for passengers.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: How about a tow? Can you rig that?

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: As soon as you get us on the island, you got to call in. My dad's the mayor...

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: You have to take us off! You have to! Why don't you take us!

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: It's an observation spotter, he doesn't have the room...

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: Listen. I'm going to give you an assist to get you on Cable Junction. Then I'll call in, and get the Coast Guard to send a cutter. Hang on to something.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Harbor Air, this is Brody. Air One, come in.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Harbor Air, do you read? Over?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Where the hell is Air One?

Speaker: patrol voice
Dialogue: That's what I'd like to know. Lost transmission at Cable Junction.

Speaker: patrol voice
Dialogue: Then nothing. If you see him, tell him to switch to an operational frequency, or give me a status report yourself.

Speaker: patrol voice
Dialogue: 1530 hours. Might still be there. Base out.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: He's got to help or it won't work.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: It killed her. It ate her.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Sean! Listen! Listen to me, Sean.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Goddamn it, Sean, you listen to me or I will kick your ass, do you hear me?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: We're throwing a rope and you better catch it, hear?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Keep an eye out for that fish.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Can someone help me rig a jury rudder? We might steer this...

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: By 7:46, when the tide turns around, we'll be twenty miles out. More, with this wind.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: God, please help us, Merciful Father, in Christ's name, we beg you, help us, please, Dear God, save us, help us, please, God, help...

Speaker: polo
Dialogue: A shark hit us out there.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I passed out, but I'm okay.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: At least you're safe. What about the others?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Jesus, don't freeze on me. What about the others?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: He wanted to come. It was okay, wasn't it? It was okay before...

Speaker: polo
Dialogue: The others are ratted together. Drifting.

Speaker: timmy
Dialogue: With the current. Towards Cable Junction.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Stay here. Don't go anywhere. Just stay here.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Bring her to port a little. That's it -- steady.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: I think we're changing course a little.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: If we can get to it.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Are we going to go on the island?

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: What the hell, we're steering for it.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Sideways -- For every yard we go this way, we also slide sideways this way...

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: But we had it! We were headed right for it!

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: It's that thing. It's going to kill us now... We're going to die!

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: It's bad enough without her freaking out.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Can you get us a line?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Hang on, hang on -- we got it. You're on!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I'm okay, baby, I'm here. It's okay...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Can you get a line to me?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Son of a bitch is stuck!

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I don't want to die! Mommy!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Come on, you bastard, come on, pull. Pull!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Andy! Use the lights! The lights!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Over here! You bastard! Over here

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Come and get me! Come and get me!

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: They made me go with them.
